ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] (OT) While we're talking viruses
ygData.msgSnippet: Thats interesting, that may explain why when I went home for lunch and decided to run the patch program to see if any new patches were posted yet and I got a
ygData.messageBody:
Thats interesting, that may explain why when I went home for lunch and
decided to run the patch program to see if any new patches were posted yet
and I got a couple of user manuals and addendums to the manuals in the patch
process with no explanation of why.

I thought it peculiar but apparently they have attempted to nip this in the
bud by overwriting the potentially infected doc files with clean ones from
the patch server. Shhhhhhh.... ;-P

-Faras

-----Original Message-----
From: Talies the Wanderer [mailto:snicker@...]
Sent: Tuesday, April 25, 2000 3:32 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: [eqbards] (OT) While we're talking viruses


It is important that you know that the Ruins of Kunark CD *may* have
included a Word Macro virus embedded in the new documents. If so, here is
the information on the virus:

http://vil.mcafee.com/dispVirus.asp?virus_k=10003

Now, I say "may" because it's possible that the infected file came from the
patch center. In either case, Abashi has stated that if you didn't open
the doc file, you are fine. If you did, you are SOL - Verant is keeping
mum about a solution. Of course, you should always have a virus scanner
running (says the guy without one) and never open anything from someone you
don't know and/or trust (yadda yadda). Thanks for shooting THAT one in the
foot, Verant :P.

Good luck to you RoK'ers - I'm not able to upgrade, so I won't be seeing
you there.

Talies the Wanderer
